definitions.definition: a powerful illegal drug that affects the mind in a harmful way. Heroin and cocaine are narcotics.

examples.text: a narcotics agent *(= a police officer investigating the illegal trade in drugs)*
He has been arrested for trading in narcotics.
Narcotics trafficking represents 30 to 50 per cent of organized crime's take.
The main reason people abuse illegal narcotics is so they may ‘escape’ from their harsh, cruel reality.

definitions.definition: a substance that relaxes you, reduces pain or makes you sleep

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French narcotique, via medieval Latin from Greek narkōtikos, from narkoun ‘make numb’.
